Class MatrixCalculations

  • java.lang.Object
    • MatrixCalculations

  • public class MatrixCalculations
extends java.lang.Object
    This class calculates all calculations needed for matrices and prints the results
    Since:
    3/20.2018

    • Constructor Detail

      • MatrixCalculations

        public MatrixCalculations(int[][] x,
                          int xn,
                          int xm,
                          int[][] y,
                          int yn,
                          int ym,
                          int xCoefficient,
                          int yCoefficient)
        Parameters:
        x - is the X matrix
        xn - rows of X
        xm - colomns of X
        y - is the Y matrix
        yn - rows of Y
        ym - colomns of Y
        xCoefficient - Coefficient of X in polynomial expression
        yCoefficient - Coefficient of Y in polynomial expression

    • Method Detail

      • updateMatrices

        public void updateMatrices()
        This method updates X and Y matrices with their coefficients. X and Y are new matrices in this class so this won't change original matrices We use these two matrices for our calculations

      • sum

        public void sum()
        Calculates and prints the summation of two matrices

      • sub

        public void sub()
        Calculates and prints the subtraction of two matrices

      • mult

        public void mult()
        calculates and prints the Multiplication of two matrices

      • printMatrix

        public void printMatrix(int[][] res,
                        int resN,
                        int resM)
        prints the result matrix
        Parameters:
        res - is the result matrix
        resN - is the number of rows of result matrix
        resM - is the number of colomns of result matrix

      • getX

        public int[][] getX()
        Returns:
        new X matrix (After updating it with coefficients)

      • getY

        public int[][] getY()
        Returns:
        new Y matrix (After updating it with coefficients)
